intro: Ribes camporum, commonly known as the camp orchard gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Grossulariaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are typically red or orange when mature, which are used in culinary applications. Ribes camporum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
